identificationModule.briefTitle: Examining the Efficacy of a Very-Low-Carbohydrate Ketogenic Diet on Cardiovascular Health in Adults with Mildly Elevated Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol
identificationModule.officialTitle: Examining the Efficacy of a Very-Low-Carbohydrate Ketogenic Diet on Cardiovascular Health in Adults with Mildly Elevated Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol in an Open-Label Pilot Study

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Open-label pilot study where all participants followed the same very-low-carbohydrate ketogenic diet (Nic's Ketogenic Diet) for 140 days

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: This was an open-label study with no masking. All participants and investigators were aware of the dietary intervention being administered.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females ages 30 to 55 years
- Body mass index (BMI) 20.0–29.9 kg/m²
- LDL-C levels between 2.5 and 4.1 mmol/L
- Deemed healthy by medical history and laboratory results by the Medical Director
- Participants were required to maintain current level of physical activity during the study

Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to give informed consent
- Women who were pregnant, breastfeeding, or planning to become pregnant, menopausal, postmenopausal
- Following a diet
- Diabetes or hypertension
- Used hypertensive medication
- A significant major cardiovascular event in the past 6 months assessed by the MD
- Kidney or liver diseases assessed by the MD
- Corticosteroids, opioid pain medications, beta-blockers and BP medications, statins, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
- Supplements known to affect weight and/or fat loss or lipid metabolism (considered after a washout period)
- Clinically significant physical examination or abnormal laboratory results
- Had any other active or unstable medical condition that, in the opinion of the MD, may have adversely affected the participant's ability to complete the study or may have posed significant risk
